item.title: The Unified Memory Revelation: Why Docker Double-Counts
item.description: The 'aha!' moment: Docker's cgroups were designed for discrete GPUs, but Grace Blackwell has unified memory. The result? Docker counts GPU memory twice, creating 20-30GB of phantom overhead.

item.title: The Mystery: Don't Just Blame the Hardware
item.description: YouTube tech reviewers were quick to blame NVIDIA's new DGX Spark for being slow. But was it really the hardware's fault, or was I missing something deeper in the software stack?
